comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Morava River in present day Republic of Serbia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_Morava

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: There is a photo of a destroyed bridge over the Morava in The Madison journal., February 19, 1916, Image 3, but it's unclear if it's the same bridge and where it is. And I found another photo of a wrecked bridge over the Morava in the Internet. There are significant similarities between the bridges, but it's obviously another bridge (besides of that, I couldn't find a village named "Praskovze"). I found several bridges, especially over the West-Morava, which could be the bridge in the Bain photo, it's perhaps the bridge at Jasika, near Krusevac (www.panoramio.com/photo/6691897) or the bridge at Trstenik (www.panoramio.com/photo/88420878).

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: artolog and B-59: Thanks for trying to identify the bridge. Definitely a tricky one!  At the very least, we can refer to the river correctly and hope for more definitive proof of the bridge identity in the future.
